entities.name: snape
entities.description: Snape is introduced as a character who is contemptuous and critical of Harry's performance in Occlumency lessons. He is described as raising his wand once more, indicating that he is a skilled wizard.

entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is introduced as the student who is struggling with Occlumency and is being taught by Snape. He is described as wanting to hear the answer to his question about whether Snape saw everything he saw.

entities.name: aunt marge
entities.description: Aunt Marge is mentioned as the owner of a dog that Harry's Occlumency lesson was focused on. She is not a direct participant in the conversation but is relevant to the context of the lesson.

relationships.description: Snape is teaching Harry Occlumency, as indicated by their interaction and Snape's criticism of Harry's performance.
Snape is connected to Aunt Marge through Harry, who mentioned that the dog belonged to her.
